item.title: ACQUIRE and Red Dunes Games announce multi-year collaboration to develop global IPs
item.content:encoded:
World premieres planned at events such as Tokyo Game Show.

United Arab Emirates-based game publisher and developer Red Dunes Games has announced a multi-year collaboration with Tokyo-based developer ACQUIRE to co-develop a slate of original intellectual properties “that blend world-class Japanese craftsmanship with bold, creative vision.”

“ACQUIRE is a legendary studio with a deep creative legacy, and we are honored to work with them to build the next wave of original games,” said Red Dunes Games CEO and creative director Sultan Darmaki in a press release. “This partnership is a reflection of our belief that the future of gaming lies in global collaboration—where stories cross borders, and innovation knows no region.”

ACQUIRE is known for titles such as Tenchu, Way of the Samurai, AKIBA’S TRIP, and Octopath Traveler.

“As ACQUIRE, a studio that has long valued originality from Japan in game development, we are thrilled to have found a wonderful partner in Red Dunes Games and embark on a bold new global challenge together,” said ACQUIRE CEO Takuma Endo. “We’ve always believed in the power of originality. Now, with Red Dunes, we’re building something truly international.”

The first wave of projects between the co-developers is as follows:

  • Project Tremor – City-shaking kaiju battles.
  • Project Umbra – Dark fantasy hunts.
  • Project Shadowcar – Shadowy espionage thriller.

Each title explores a distinct genre and vision. All games will launch on PC and major consoles, with global releases, multilingual support, and world premieres planned at events such as Tokyo Game Show.

The collaboration is described as a cornerstone in Red Dunes Games’ long-term publishing and co-development vision, which combines original game creation with a global outlook, industry partnerships, and a commitment to diverse storytelling.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/acquire-and-red-dunes-games-announce-multi-year-collaboration-to-develop-global-ips

item.title: This Week’s Japanese Game Releases: Donkey Kong Bananza, EDENS ZERO, more
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact, Shadow Labyrinth, etc.

Donkey Kong Bananza for Switch 2 and EDENS ZERO for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC are the highlights of this week’s Japanese video game releases.

Also due out this week are Shadow Labyrinth for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and Switch, and Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC.

Get the full list of this week’s Japanese game releases below. It should be noted that Gematsu will receive a small percentage of money from purchases made through Play-Asia links. You can also save five percent with our multi-use “GEMATSU2025” coupon code.

Physical and Digital

  • Daisenryaku SSB (PS5)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot DAIMA Edition (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Switch)
    • European Version (PS5, Switch)
  • EDENS ZERO (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series)
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series)
    • Asian Version (PS5)
  • Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact (PS5, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
    • Limited Edition (PS5, Switch)
    • North American Version
      • Standard Edition (PS5, Switch)
      • Limited Edition (PS5, Switch)
    • European Version
      • Standard Edition (PS5, Switch)
      • Limited Edition (PS5, Switch)
    • Asian Version (PS5, Switch)
  • Shadow Labyrinth (PS5, Switch 2, Switch) – Launching worldwide. Switch 2 version is a code in a box.
    • North American Version
      • Standard Edition (PS5, Switch)
      • Secret Edition (PS5, Switch)
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2, Switch)
  • Snow Bros. Special Anniversary Edition (Switch)
  • TEVI (Switch) – Already available worldwide.

Digital Only

  • Ad SHOOt (Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Arashi Gaiden (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • A-RED Walking Robot (PS5, PS4, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Atomic Owl (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Bridge Constructor Studio (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store, GOG], iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • BUSTAFELLOWS Season 2 (PC [Steam]) – Also launching for Switch in the west.
    • North American Version (Switch)
    • European Version (Switch)
  • Destiny 2: The Edge of Fate (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Drill Core (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • EDENS ZERO (Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Eriksholm: The Stolen Dream (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Lost in Prayer Early Access (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Neon Abyss 2 Early Access (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Puella Magi Madoka Magica: Magia Exedra (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Ready or Not (PS5, Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Shadow Labyrinth (Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Twisted Metal III (PS5, PS4) – Launching worldwide.
  • Twisted Metal 4 (PS5, PS4) – Launching worldwide.
  • Upin & Ipin Universe (PS5, PS4, Switch, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • The Wandering Village (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.

The PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch titles listed above can be purchased through Japanese PlayStation Network and Nintendo accounts using prepaid cards:

  • PlayStation Store cards (yen): 1,100 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 10,000
  • Nintendo eShop cards (yen): 1,000 / 1,500 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 9,000

Demos, Betas, Updates, etc.

  • Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot Downloadable Content “DAIMA: Adventure Through the Demon Realm – Part 1″ (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC) – Launching worldwide.
  • Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.1 update “The Impending Crash of Waves” (PS5, Xbox Series, PC, iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/this-weeks-japanese-game-releases-donkey-kong-bananza-edens-zero-more

item.title: World’s End Club now available for PS5
item.content:encoded:
Publisher IzanagiGames and developer Too Kyo Games have released World’s End Club for PlayStation 5 via PlayStation Store for $24.99 / £19.99 / €24.99 / 2,350 yen, the companies announced.

World’s End Club was previously released for Switch, PC via Steam, and iOS.

Here is an overview of the game, via IzanagiGames:

About

Twelve kids. A 1200km journey.

A new type of action adventure game that fuses a thrilling story with 2D side-scrolling action.

A “dream team” adventure game with scenario written by Zero Escape series creator, Kotaro Uchikoshi, and Danganronpa‘s Kazutaka Kodaka as creative director.

Story

In an elementary school in Tokyo, there’s a club called the “Go-Getters Club” made up from oddball kids from all over Japan. Reycho and the other members are somehow different than the other kids around them.

Then, one day, during the summer…

While on the bus for their class trip, they get into an accident.

When they wake up, they’re in a theme park under the sea.

Reycho and the others are trapped inside this strange, long-abandoned place.

Suddenly, from out of nowhere, a mysterious clown appears and orders them to play a “Fate Game!”

Before any of them can figure out what’s happening, they’re fighting for their very lives.

Will they be able to survive and make it out of this weird place?

The kids are all lost and confused…

But then, extraordinary powers begin to awaken within them.

While at the same time…

“Abnormal events” are occurring all over the Earth.

Key Features

  • Simple controls.
  • A fusion of 2D scrolling puzzle-action game and story-adventure game.
  • Key player choices alter the course of the adventure throughout the branching story.
  • 12 unique and interesting characters!
  • Famous locations all over Japan.
  • The story unfolds in… unexpected ways.


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/worlds-end-club-now-available-for-ps5
